About recommendations we've heard today many times how search is important for the people and I recorded this was really a changing point of view when I read this article by Rose and Levinson, where they said that when people look for something, for example using Google, they actually can have one of the three different agendas they might be looking for research that the resource they might just navigate the web.
Or they might be looking for an information, so why people need something more than just search in specific fields like for example in E Commerce or in knowledge base?
Mostly because they are too lazy or they might be getting lost in hyperspace.
And this is a result of evaluation that we did two years ago using our system Jerome DL.
We learned that people were really happy when they finally were able to use the.
Recommendation solutions instead of just simple search or browsing technologies.
So also what we think is the key selling point in our approach towards recommendations is that we don't think about semantics as we see many people think.

Very Luckily I can say that what I heard today is not the case, but we stumbled upon many companies that were saying we are doing semantic web, when in fact they were just doing natural language processing in a best best part of what they doing so they weren't taking into account the link database out there, they were in take into account the social interactions and and and the contribution that could be could be leveraged.
So this is, this is where we see the potential, not just in extracting semantics from the text and then from the query an matching altogether.
But also taking into account what's out there in the linked data space and what's already provided as a social contribution.
So and when you look at the recommendations for a comma.
US people are looking for goods and services, not just links.
And when you translate into these three types of agendas that people might have, these are the resource seeking or navigational depending what what kind of interaction the user might have.
So how can our solution can help?
We might help the our customers.
Our B2B customers in increasing their revenue by providing their end users with matching better.
Recommending better goods and services by matching their profiles and and doing some similarities on the resource information.
So we will navigate them towards more purchases.
Better purchases.
Now when you look from the knowledge base perspective.
People are not looking for rings, they are looking for answers and very often they even don't know the question, so they're looking for information and sometimes they have to navigate.

So if we are able to recommend the content from the context perceptive, often a knowledge worker, for example, we are able to train the time that is required to perform each task and again our business partner that we use our recommendation will be able to gain on the effort that his knowledge workers.
Had to spend in order to perform the tasks.
So this is our road map to success.
Started with the research prototypes systems like drawn DL and notice that I told you about in a cloud of various other solutions that we've been working on for last couple of years.
We are now in a stage of building and helping to build the website at all ecosystem.

That is let's say next generation of Noticias.

Taxonomy and Tazari as a link data and hopefully other services will be able to reuse it, which makes the semantic were better when you also start to the semantic school which is a block at the moment only in Polish.

But the blog that aims in one thing to make people aware about semantic web better and understand the problem better where we are heading towards is the generating revenue from this services and we think that it will take about 2 two to four years.
To actually get there, and it's not only because the team is small, it's the market.
The web is not already yet before ready for for everything, so we have to.

With this recommendation services.

That you can do it this way.

It's more like a software service where existing E Commerce platforms can hook into us to get the brother recommendations for they their products for their sales.
That's that's that's where we see ourselves, actually.
